text:
March 29, 1967
Congressman Daniel E. Button
Room 1513
Longworth House Office Bldg.
Washington, D. C.
Dear Dan:
Thanks so much for the time that you and George Linn spent
on ray recent visit.
Your willingness to sight WAMC in the Congressional Record as
an example of what radio could accomplish under the Public
Television Act is sincerely appreciated. I feel certain that
it will contribute to the radio cause nationally.
If it is not too much trouble please continue sending me items
that you feel I may have missed, since they are quite helpful.
Your offer to help us via the new Public Affairs Service has
been conveyed to the Director of Rational Educational Radio,
Mr. Sandler, and to the producer of the program, Mr. Bill Greenwood.
I am sure you will hear from either or both of these gentlemen.
Please convey ray appreciation to George and your entire staff for
the courtesies extended. Best personal regards.
Sincerely,
Albert P. Fredette
Manager
APF-.RG
